Ingredients.1: 6 large poblano peppers, halved and seeded

Ingredients.2: 0.5 pounds ground beef, or to taste

Ingredients.10: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.12: 2 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chile peppers

Ingredients.14: 3 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, or to taste

Directions.1: Set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Place poblano peppers cut-side down onto the prepared baking sheet.

Directions.2: Cook under the preheated broiler until poblano pepper skins have blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes. Place blackened peppers into a bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Allow peppers to steam as they cool, about 10 minutes.

Directions.3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef, chili powder, garlic, cumin, oregano, cayenne pepper, paprika, chipotle pepper, salt, and black pepper. Cook and stir until beef is no longer pink, about 4 minutes. Add onion; cook until slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Add tomatoes with green chiles; cook until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes more. Let beef mixture cool.

Directions.4: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a casserole dish with cooking spray.

Directions.5: Run water over the poblano peppers to remove skins and discard them; drain peppers on paper towels. Place a layer of peppers on the bottom of the prepared dish; place 1/3 of the beef mixture on top. Cover with 1 cup shredded Mexican cheese blend. Repeat layers twice more in the same order.

Directions.6: Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, about 35 minutes.
